docs.snippet: In its first year of operation by Moore-McCormack Lines, Inc., the passenger service of the American Republics Line transported 16,060 passengers to and from the east coast ports of South America, it was announced yesterday by Leo E. Archer, general...
docs.lead_paragraph: In its first year of operation by Moore-McCormack Lines, Inc., the passenger service of the American Republics Line transported 16,060 passengers to and from the east coast ports of South America, it was announced yesterday by Leo E. Archer, general passenger traffic manager.

headline.main: 16,060 ARE CARRIED BY LINE 1ST YEAR; Moore-McCormack Reports on Operation of the American Republics Vessels

docs.snippet: Almost all Latin-American countries have shortages of foreign exchange and regulations of varying degrees for the supplies that they have. The answer to the question, how much more we can sell them, depends on our purchases from those countries.
